BudgetSubActivityTitle.val: Elect Equip - Tact Int Rel Act (TIARA)

Description.val:
Special Purpose Systems (BZ9751): Technical Insertions (TI) will be made to the ground-based Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) system with additional capabilities required by theater units to effectively engage enemy forces and provide Force Protection information to friendly forces. Procure Government and Commercial off-the-shelf (GOTS/COTS) Next Generation SIGINT capabilities that are theater specific and enable the Prophet system to address specific threats and Signals of Interest (SOI). Prophet Enhanced is the tactical commander's sole organic ground-based SIGINT/Electronic Warfare system for the Multi-Function Teams (MfTs), Stryker Brigade Combat Teams (SBCTs), and Expeditionary-Military Intelligence Brigades (E-MIBs).  Its primary mission is to provide 24-hour Situation Development and Information Superiority to the supported maneuver brigade to enable the most effective engagement of enemy forces.  Prophet Enhanced provides a modular, scalable, open architecture-based system solution optimized for ease of use in a variety of configurations (Stationary-Fixed, Mobile and Manpack). It also incorporates the ability for rapid integration of TI to ensure operational relevance.

Prophet Enhanced Modifications MIP (BZ9753): In FY18, PdM Prophet will continue modification to retrofit, test, train, and support previously fielded Prophet Enhanced systems not currently hosted on a prime mover to the latest mounted configuration.  Prophet Enhanced is the tactical commander's sole organic ground-based SIGINT/Electronic Warfare system for the Multi-Function Teams (MfTs), Stryker Brigade Combat Teams (SBCTs), and Expeditionary-Military Intelligence Brigades (E-MIBs).  Its primary mission is to provide 24-hour Situation Development and Information Superiority to the supported maneuver brigade to enable the most effective engagement of enemy forces.  It also incorporates the ability for rapid integration of Technical Insertions to ensure operational relevance.

Justification.val:
FY 2018 Base procurement funding in the amount of $4.241 million will support the implementation of Modern signal-of-interest (SOI) enhancements for Prophet Enhanced.   An upgraded software capability will ensure that Prophet remains relevant against modern threats, providing an open architecture that allows capability integration to address advanced signal types in a constantly changing spectrum environment. There will be no hardware purchased in FY18, therefore a specific quantity cannot be applied to the distribution.

FY 2018 Base procurement funding in the amount of $46.793 million supports the modification of 12 legacy systems, procurement of 30 dismount SIGINT Manpacks, plus associated support, integration and testing for these systems. FY2018 Training/Fielding represents the delivery and New Equipment Training (NET) of the FY2017 Prophet Enhanced systems. 

FY2018 OCO procurement funding in the amount of $2.300 million procures 12 dismount SIGINT Manpacks; six of the Manpacks will be fielded to units located within the U.S. Army Europe (USAREUR) area of responsibility and six of the Manpacks will be fielded to units within the Global Response Force (GRF) area of responsibility.

All funding is for the Active component.

Army Acquisition Objective (AAO): 225

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val: FY 2018 Base procurement funding in the amount of $4.241 million will support the implementation of modern signal-of-interest software upgrades for Prophet Enhanced; there will be no hardware purchased in FY18, therefore a specific quantity can not be applied to the distribution.

FY 2018 Base procurement funding in the amount of $46.793 million supports the modification of 12 legacy systems, procurement of 30 dismount SIGINT Manpacks (to be fielded to Regionally Aligned Forces), plus associated support, integration and testing for these systems.

FY2018 OCO procurement funding in the amount of $2.300 million procures 12 dismount SIGINT Manpacks; six of the Manpacks will be fielded to units located within the U.S. Army Europe (USAREUR) area of responsibility and six of the Manpacks will be fielded to units within the Global Response Force (GRF) area of responsibility.
